p: FN1 is a multifunctional glycoprotein that serves in the plasma and extracellular matrix as a soluble dimer, or at the cell surface as a dimer or multimer. It participates in multiple biological processes, including cell adhesion, migration, wound healing, and blood coagulation ( 30). Both CAD and CAA are characterized by endothelial dysfunction and stress responses to wound healing. Therefore, the decrease in FN1 expression levels in patients with coronary artery lesions may be associated with the aforementioned pathways.
